tweet: #MD06 is home to great small businesses that keep our community and economies strong. Happy #SmallBusinessSaturday and remember to shop local!

In between football and eating leftovers, take a moment to ensure you have the benefits and protections you need to stay healthy and thrive next year. Open Enrollment closes December 15th, so sign up today! https://www.marylandhealthconnection.gov/

Happy Thanksgiving! I am thankful for my family, our health, and for the great honor of representing the people of Maryland's 6th District. Wishing you all a happy day surrounded by loved ones. pic.twitter.com/YDjsbVTEW2

On one of the busiest travel days of the year, let's thank our hard-working TSA officers who are keeping us safe this holiday season. While they protect our families, they often work long hours & miss their own family gatherings. Thank you for all you do! #ThankATSO

Thanks to Karen from Frederick for sending in this great photo of Baker Park! I love seeing your great social media photo contest entries. If you haven’t sent in your photos yet, you still have time. Learn more and enter now:  https://trone.house.gov/photocontest  pic.twitter.com/YRvTDfN5qu

Gender-based violence is one of the most widespread human rights violations. On International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women, I am happy to help introduce the International Violence Against Women Act in the House. Women's rights are human rights. #IVAWA

We should do everything we can to protect those who have served our country. Last week, I sent a letter to the FBI and Department of Justice asking  what reporting they've done or action they’ve taken on hate crimes against military service members.  http://trone.house.gov/sites/trone.house.gov/files/Veteran%20Hate%20Crime%20Data%20Collection%20and%20Guidance.pdf … pic.twitter.com/e5dPwahY7s
Looks like we’re writing a bill! @SpanbergerVA07 https://twitter.com/SpanbergerVA07/status/1198767380392022023 …
Do I really have to write a bill to ban charging prisoners to read? https://twitter.com/DrRJKavanagh/status/1198293579707375616 …

#TeamTrone attended the Grand Opening of Brook Lane’s new space for their Integrated Substance Abuse Treatment Program (InSTEP). Brook Lane has offered substance abuse treatment & mental health programs in Washington County for the last 70 years. Thank you for all you do! pic.twitter.com/Am74tCw6l4

#TeamTrone attended the Grand Opening of @HorizonGoodwill's Young Adult Solution Center in Hagerstown, which offers young adults struggling with the transition into adulthood the support they need to succeed. Thank you for investing in Washington County! pic.twitter.com/VbFEhil0UQ

#TeamTrone was pleased to meet with the Greater Maryland Chapter of the Alzheimer’s Association this week. Alzheimer’s affects 110,000 individuals in MD alone. That's why we have to increase funding for the @NIH so they can find a cure and #EndALZ. pic.twitter.com/MnSMfgcYHR

Had a great meeting with Ambassador to China Terry Branstad where we discussed how Congress can work with the State Department to stop the flow of fentanyl from China. Fentanyl is huge problem and we need to take action or risk losing more American lives to the addiction crisis. pic.twitter.com/Dp9l5xTiLp

Since 2002 the number of babies born experiencing opioid withdrawal symptoms has increased 5x. This bill would offer support for mothers & babies affected by the opioid epidemic. Proud to introduce this bill which helps our most vulnerable citizens. https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/reps-trone-thompson-kuster-and-guthrie-introduce-bipartisan-legislation-support …

When Verso closed Luke Mill earlier this year they pulled the rug out from under employees. I am committed to supporting our workers. That's why I introduced legislation to protect our workers & hold businesses accountable. Our workers deserve better. https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-trone-introduces-legislation-strengthen-worker-protections …

Did you COPD affects 16 million people nationwide? This COPD Awareness month, we are raising awareness and promoting earlier diagnosis and treatment. You can learn more here:   http://copd.nhlbi.nih.gov

Thanksgiving is approaching, and I am thankful for the support my colleagues have given me this past year. Two months ago they joined me for #CongressGoesPurple to raise awareness about mental & substance use disorders & celebrate Americans in recovery. https://twitter.com/i/moments/1177218947386630145 …

You can access quality, affordable health care coverage for yourself & your family. Ensure you have the benefits and protections you need to stay healthy & thrive. Don't wait: open enrollment closes December 15th!  http://www.marylandhealthconnection.gov

Apprenticeships are America's most successful workforce training program. That's why yesterday, I questioned the Department of Labor's Assistant Secretary for Employment and Training John Pallasch about why funds are being diverted away from Registered Apprenticeships. pic.twitter.com/iwBIumrR6t

I had the distinct pleasure of meeting with Ilham Ahmed, President of the Syrian Democratic Council. We have to protect our Kurdish allies and uphold the promises we made years ago. President Trump is wrecking havoc in the region. pic.twitter.com/1Dpt7bCMC8

Iranian citizens are protesting because they're legitimately upset with terrible policies from the regime. Communications blackouts are a tool to repress your population, not a sign of victory. #iranprotests https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/20/middleeast/iran-fuel-protests-intl/index.html …
Full implementation of Colombia’s Peace Agreement is critical for a stable and lasting peace. I stand with those who are advocating and working for a bright future for Colombia.

34 million Americans know someone who has died in the past five years because they cannot afford medical treatment. That is beyond unacceptable. It's time to make this a thing of the past. That's why I'm fighting for #LowerDrugCosts now. https://news.gallup.com/poll/268094/millions-lost-someone-couldn-afford-treatment.aspx?utm_source=facebookbutton&utm_medium=facebook&utm_campaign=sharing&fbclid=IwAR1nlkUGLDMqCNrbaJoBxV5yHqdXes8rk7KA4Hh_d8W6XnIK8S4CRQxU8NM …
Have you taken photos of the beautiful region we live in? I’m holding a social media cover photo contest and your photo could be featured on my pages! Enter now: https://trone.house.gov/photocontest
Latina women make 54 cents on the dollar. That’s unacceptable. Let’s commit to closing the gap on #LatinaEqualPayDay and pass the Paycheck Fairness Act. pic.twitter.com/5E8yNLVHM2
This year we've lost at least 23 transgender Americans to anti-trans hate, violence, and bigotry. On #TDOR, let's commit to loving our neighbors, no exceptions.

The Bipartisan Opioid Task Force is making real strides against the addiction crisis. I was happy to join the roundtable yesterday and learn about how we can protect our communities from the opioid epidemic. Thanks as always for hosting a great discussion! pic.twitter.com/l3cSkha0uQ

I had a great meeting with @ONDCP Director Jim Carroll yesterday to discuss how the federal government is working to combat the opioid crisis. We all have to work together if we want to make any real progress to #EndTheAddictionCrisis. pic.twitter.com/X5OufY5GPV

Alzheimer's is a debilitating disease that affects more than 5.5 million people across the country. During National Alzheimer's month, I am committed to continuing the fight for funding to find a cure and #EndALZ.

I was happy to stop by the @SpecialOlympics reception to meet Special Olympics Athletes and toast to this season of inclusion. Always great to see my friends @TimShriver & @somd_jim and meet some amazing athletes. pic.twitter.com/AlRs3ATJtW

News You Can Use: A nationwide telemarketing scam has been uncovered in Montgomery County.   https://bethesdamagazine.com/bethesda-beat/government/montgomery-county-uncovers-nationwide-telemarketing-scam/ …
These scams are all too common. That's why I'm hosting a consumer protection roundtable on December 12th. Register now: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/consumer-protection-workshop-with-congressman-david-trone-registration-82821869441 …
Congratulations to the Mountain Ridge Miners on their triumph in the 1A Boys Soccer State Championship! Your hard work and perseverance has paid off. What a way to end the season. @ACPSchools

This Transgender Awareness Week we hear, uplift, and celebrate the voices of the trans community and remember those we've lost to hate. We've made progress, but we still have so much work to do. We see you and I will continue to fight for you. #TransWeek

The @HagerstownSuns and the @FrederickKeys are home runs for our communities and local economy. That's why I sent a letter asking the @MLB to reconsider their plan to shrink the number of minor league teams. https://twitter.com/RepLoriTrahan/status/1196812164016885766 …

Access to a postsecondary education is essential to reforming the criminal justice system. The College Affordability Act includes my bill to expand access to Pell Grants for students impacted by the justice system. It just makes sense. https://www.newamerica.org/education-policy/reports/equipping-individuals-life-beyond-bars/ …
More than 90% of new or commonly prescribed drugs rely on the @NIH for funding. It's clear: NIH funding is money well spent.

#NativeAmericanHeritageMonth gives us a chance to celebrate the incredible contributions of Native Americans to our country. 

Learn more about Native American heritage: https://americanindian.si.edu/nk360

This week is American Education Week. I'm celebrating teachers, parents, and support professionals who are making a difference in the lives of our students each and every day. I am committed to ensuring every child receives a quality education.

Thank you @BroadFutures for honoring me tonight at your Lighting the Way Fall Gala. I am committed to creating an inclusive workplace for all. I look forward to our continued partnership for years to come! pic.twitter.com/rgQLho4TAE
$107 million less. Try telling that to the families of the 192 Americans we lose every day to an overdose. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-opioids-litigation-oklahoma-idUSKBN1XP27F …

Great meeting students from Walter Johnson High School this morning! I always love meeting students from the district. Thank you for your awesome questions & enthusiasm for government. I can't wait to see what you all accomplish! @WJWildcats @WJPrincipal

Thank you to @RepSherrill & @GReschenthaler for helping with this event. I also want to thank @RepTimBurchett, @RepJasonCrow, @RepJohnJoyce, @RepGregStanton, @RepVanTaylor, @RepRashida, & @RepLoriTrahan for participating in our conversation. We will continue to work for our vets. pic.twitter.com/yY8eV7c0i1

This morning the Freshmen Working Group on Addiction discussed how we can best support our veterans with substance use disorder. Thank you Dr. David Carroll (@VeteransHealth), Carmine Deo (@CommunityHopeNJ), & Geraldine Moss (True North) for lending your voices to the discussion. pic.twitter.com/41b4k9uQke

During National Family Caregivers Month, know that it is okay to ask for help. If you are caring for a veteran who is enrolled in VA healthcare, you are eligible for the VA Caregiver Support Line. Call 855-260-3274 to learn more.

.@RepBrianFitz and I are committed to ending the opioid epidemic. Thank you for partnering with me on #CongressGoesPurple and for sitting down with me today to talk about next steps. pic.twitter.com/TzmGbWCWMz

During National Apprenticeship Week, I joined a bipartisan group from @EdLaborCmte to discuss how we can strengthen & modernize our Registered Apprenticeship system. I'm working on a bill to connect justice-impacted communities with apprenticeships. A great discussion all around. pic.twitter.com/MJQUwdECX9

I’m asking colleagues to sign a letter to the DOJ and FBI to find out what reporting and action they’ve done on hate crimes against military service members. We should fully support those who serve our country.

Enough is enough. No child should fear for their lives while at school. Thinking of those in California and once again calling on @senatemajldr to act. https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/santa-clarita-school-shooting/index.html …
Today, I got to question the Chairman of the Federal Reserve Jerome Powell about the stagnating wages for American workers. Listen here: pic.twitter.com/8q6tBDJrcG

November is National #DiabetesMonth. In the US 30 million adults are living with diabetes & 84 million with prediabetes. It's essential we lower the skyrocketing cost of insulin. I'm a proud cosponsor of #HR3 to save Americans money at the pharmacy counter. https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/trone-releases-report-high-price-prescription-drugs-6th-district-maryland …

Can someone explain how it’s okay to deny a White House visit to Ukraine’s President Zelensky because he didn’t launch an investigation into the President's political rivals but it’s okay to host Turkey’s President Erdogan when he DID launch attacks on the US-allied SDF in Syria?

Israel has a right to defend its people against rocket attacks from Islamic Jihad. I join in condemning this rocket fire. My thoughts are with the residents of southern and central Israel. https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1194169234026352640 …
Happening Now: Ambassador Taylor and Deputy Assistant Secretary Kent testify in open impeachment inquiry https://twitter.com/HouseDemocrats/status/1194627261057523717 …

83% of Americans support #DACA. Dreamers have built their lives here. They don't know any other country as home. SCOTUS needs to recognize that #HomeIsHome and protect our neighbors, family, and friends.

It was an honor to meet so many veterans, including a 98-year-old veteran who fought in Normandy. I will continue to work in Washington for legislation to best support our veterans. pic.twitter.com/HVm2dumonl

I was honored to host a Veterans Day luncheon this afternoon to thank our service members for their great duty to our country. We are forever indebted to all you have given us. This lunch was just a small token of our appreciation for your service. pic.twitter.com/DMYB4yOPiF

This morning, I joined Morris Frock American Legion Post 42 as we laid a wreath in honor of all those who have served our country. We will never forget your great courage and strength. It is because of you that America stands strong today. pic.twitter.com/SnVvyy7cG4

Today we honor those who served in the military & their families. Let's thank veterans for their service, acknowledge their contributions to our national security, & underscore their sacrifice & duty to our country. To our veterans in #MD06 & across the country: Thank you.

On this day in 1775, the Continental Congress created what would become the @USMC. Thank you for standing for honor, courage and commitment. We salute you and are forever grateful for keeping our country safe.

Happy 50th Anniversary @sesamestreet! That's 50 years of sunny days. Your commitment to education and community development is unmatched. I am proud to cosponsor H.Res.540 which recognizes the incredible accomplishments of Sesame Street. Here's to 50 more!

Team Trone has been working on interviewing applicants for military service academies since 8:30am today. Thank you to all of our distinguished panelists and good luck to all of the high school students applying! Your willingness to serve our country is inspirational. pic.twitter.com/ObraNMNFuR

If we want to reduce recidivism, we have to provide support to justice-impacted citizens within the first few days after reentry. Only through these programs can we help Americans find their footing. https://www.washingtonpost.com/magazine/2019/10/28/this-man-was-just-released-prison-after-serving-years-photographer-was-there-meet-him-facilitys-gate/?arc404=true …

November is National Hospice and Palliative Care Month. I was proud to cosponsor and help pass HR467 which strengthens education and training for hospice & palliative care. I will continue to support patients, doctors, and caregivers across the country.

In 1965 the Higher Education Act was signed into law to strengthen our colleges & universities. Last week the College Affordability Act passed through @EdLaborCmte. I support this bill that continues the work of HEA by making college more accessible & affordable for all.

Thanks to funding from the @NIH, the flu shot allows us to protect our communities from a potentially deadly flu season. We need to increase funding for the NIH so they can continue to develop life-saving drugs. It's a no brainer.

Americans deserve access to quality health care. Affordable rates are available now under the ACA. It's time to #getcovered. Open enrollment ends on December 15th. http://www.marylandhealthconnection.gov/

Illegal fentanyl coming in from China is a major factor in the 68,500 drug overdose deaths we had in the US last year. This is a good step from China, but we still need more. They have to pursue rigorous enforcement, make it consistent, and make it count. https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia-pacific/china-touts-crackdown-on-fentanyl-urged-by-trump-as-it-sentences-drug-ring-members/2019/11/07/d72c2196-010c-11ea-8341-cc3dce52e7de_story.html …

Protesters in Iraq are demanding an end to corruption and economic development that will bring jobs. Real reform is difficult but worthwhile. These grievances are legitimate, and the US should stand ready to help Iraq. https://www.npr.org/2019/11/05/776051741/they-have-stolen-everything-from-us-iraqs-anti-government-protests-continue …

"Social isolation & loneliness ... have a greater adverse effect on health than better-known risk factors such as obesity and smoking." - @ArthurCEvans

Proud to lead legislation to tackle this issue and support aging Americans.

At today’s tour of the @portofbalt, I heard from @CBP about the interdiction of fentanyl into the US. We lose 192 Americans every day to an overdose. We have to tackle this crisis from all angles to get that number down to zero. pic.twitter.com/0lk4yk28zb

I had a great conversation today with @mayorbcyoung about how we can work together between Washington and Baltimore to #EndTheAddictionCrisis, increase access to mental health care, and fix the unjust criminal justice system. I look forward to our continued partnership! pic.twitter.com/UrFL1yetGv

We need more resources to support our first responders. It's time to take this issue out of the shadows and shed some light on this growing crisis. https://bethesdamagazine.com/bethesda-beat/police-fire/first-responders-demand-better-resources-for-mental-health-struggles/ …

Congratulations to Montgomery County’s new Chief of Police, Marcus Jones. Thank you for joining us this morning for such an important discussion. Our community is in good hands. @mcpnews pic.twitter.com/W7iSbOlFL0

I promise to take this discussion back to Washington and fight for first responders across the country. https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-david-trone-hosts-rockville-roundtable-first-responders-discuss-urgent-need …

In 2019 alone, over 180 officers have died by suicide. We need to do more to support the mental health and wellbeing of our first responders, just as they support the wellbeing of our communities. pic.twitter.com/5GejJJL2ib

This morning we gathered community leaders to discuss how we can best support law enforcement, fire, emergency medical, and 911 dispatch professionals in the fight against our mental health crisis. pic.twitter.com/8ERMk7VMhk

It was great to be back this morning at @RinkerMaterials to tour the facility and talk to their hard-working employees. Their Frederick County facility is essential for maintaining critical infrastructure projects across MD and the rest of the country. Thanks for having me! pic.twitter.com/1oaoib2OOs

Had a great visit with the Bender JCC of Greater Washington! Thank you for the great discussion about bipartisan steps we can take to support Israel as an ally. Conversations like these are some of my favorite parts of my job.

As we work in the House to pass #LowerDrugCosts, I promise to advocate for Maryland constituents who today shared their experiences facing high copays at the pharmacy counter. This bill is good for patients, good for doctors, & good for our economy. https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-david-trone-hosts-gaithersburg-roundtable-marylanders-struggling-afford …

At this morning's roundtable on Prescription Drug Prices we heard from patients, doctors, & advocates about how they are affected by the skyrocketing cost of prescription drugs. Thank you to all our participants & experts for lending your voices to this important discussion. pic.twitter.com/pVb31vEYA8

Gaithersburg & Rockville residents: Remember to get out and vote today! Local elections are important. Your voice and your vote matter.

Rockville, deliver vote-by-mail ballots OR register and vote at City Hall

Gaithersburg, find your polling place here:  https://voterservices.elections.maryland.gov/VoterSearch

My nephew Ian died of a fentanyl overdose alone in his hotel room. 

As Purdue Pharma and other companies responsible for fueling this epidemic start to settle, I wrote about how we need to spend this money to solve the root cause of the crisis. https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/voices/2019/11/05/opioid-addiction-purdue-pharma-sackler-settlement-column/4155494002/ …

"I want you to listen to the scientists. And I want you to unite behind the science. And then I want you to take action." -@GretaThunberg

November is American Indian Heritage Month. This month, we pay tribute to the rich ancestry and traditions of American Indians. We must continue to work to amplify Indigenous voices in Congress.

November is Alzheimer's Month. I am proud to fight for @NIH research funding to battle this devastating disease and was happy to lead provisions in the Dignity in Aging Act that extend benefits to those with younger-onset Alzheimer's. Together we can #EndALZ
¡Feliz Día de Los Muertos! This weekend gives those celebrating a chance to honor the lives of those they’ve lost and keep their memory alive. Wishing all a joyous holiday. #DiaDeMuertos
Our Muslim community has contributed so much to Montgomery County. Thank you to the Islamic Society of Germantown and the Islamic Center of Maryland for welcoming me so warmly today.
Thank you to @RepLoriTrahan for your leadership on this issue and to @RepJackBergman, @RepBuddyCarter, @RepHalRogers, and @RepAnnieKuster for helping introduce this bill.

The MATE Act is commonsense bipartisan legislation. It standardizes training for medical professionals so they can better treat patients with substance use disorder. This policy is another step in the right direction. #EndTheAddictionCrisis https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-david-trone-leads-bipartisan-introduction-medication-access-and …

#TeamTrone was happy to attend the groundbreaking of @WashingtonCoMD's new Public Safety Training Center. This state of the art facility will allow our first responders across all departments to learn and train together to best serve our community. #MD06 https://twitter.com/WashingtonCoMD/status/1189305548577095686 …

November is Military Family Appreciation Month. Military families know what it means to serve. Thank you for your commitment & contributions in support of our military & nation.
